title: DrDisrespect studio Midnight Society announces closure four months after "significant" layoffs
description: Midnight Society, the studio co-founded by controversial streamer Guy "Dr Disrespect" Beahm, is shutting its doors, four months after making "significant" layoffs. The news comes as Google announces it's lifting Beahm's YouTube monetisation ban, which was put in place following his admission of "inappropriate" behaviour with a "minor" last year. Read more
author: Matt Wales

title: Devil May Cry's animated Netflix series gets April release date, Limp Bizkit opener

title: Dark Souls Graphic Novel Slipcase Box Set Is Nearly 50% Off At Amazon
description: Dark Souls Graphic Novel Box Set (Volumes 1-3) Box Set - $28.49 (was $50) | Omnibus - $25 (was $35) Get Box Set at Amazon Get Box Set at Target Get Complete Collection at Amazon Titan Comics recently reissued the first three Dark Souls graphic novels in box set format, but you can already save nearly 50% on the three-volume paperback set at Amazon. Normally $50, the Dark Souls 1-3 Slipcase Set is on sale for only $28.49. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Dark Horse's Deluxe Edition Dragon Age Art Book Is Steeply Discounted At Amazon
description: The Art of Dragon Age: The Veilguard Deluxe Edition $79.31 (was $100) See at Amazon The Art of Dragon Age: The Veilguard $38.30 (was $50) See at Amazon Dragon Age fans can pick up the official art book for The Veilguard at a fairly substantial discount for a limited time at Amazon. The Deluxe Edition hardcover is up for grabs for $79.31 (was $100), while the standard hardcover version is $38.30 (was $50). Published by Dark Horse in November, The Art of Dragon Age: The Veilguard was created in collaboration with the BioWare development team, and features 256 pages full of concept art, promotional illustrations, and more. If you haven't picked up the game yet, Amazon and GameStop are selling Dragon Age: The Veilguard for only $25 (was $70), but this deal likely won't be available for very long.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Vampire: The Masquerade writer's new dark fantasy vania also features vampires, plus screaming spiders
description: Mandragora: Whispers Of The Witch Tree is a 2.5D Soulsvania from Primal Game Studio, in which you electrify, bisect or incinerate handsome, ravening night creatures in a world of heaped skulls and burning spires. Yes, I'm well aware that "2.5D" and "Soulsvania" are nonsense words, woven by pestilent market forces. Samuel Johnson is turning in his grave, I expect. He has risen from his grave and equipped himself with an ironbound dictionary and is even now making his way through the layers of the English language, hellbent on slaughtering every 'vania yet coined. But never mind Samuel. Oversized rodents and spiders aside, Mandragora is notable for being written by Brian Mitsoda, writer of the original Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines and the former narrative lead for its sequel at Hardsuit Labs, which lives on in the hands of The Chinese Room. Primal have just announced a release date - 17th April. Here's a trailer. Read more
author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell

title: Citizen Sleeper 2: Starward Vector review: a sci-fi RPG that explores new space, yet I yearn for old ground
description: Don't get too comfortable. As an RPG that puts you in the synthetic boots of an escaped robo-person, Citizen Sleeper 2 often has you on the run. It's a crunchy, dicey machine of vibrant world-building that sometimes forgets itself in wandering prose. A compelling universe to sail through, with more habitats and hovels than its predecessor, more stations and stellar gateways. It can't - for me - escape the dense gravity of the first game's compact storytelling and novel character building, no matter how often it funnels you from one space caper to the next. But it has a good time trying. Read more
author: Brendan Caldwell

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 866
description: So‚Ä¶what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn‚Äôt, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It‚Äôs just a list of more or less random questions I‚Äôve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Pick one: colorful shoes or a colorful sweater? Let‚Äôs go with the colorful shoes. Life is too short for boring footwear! 2. Which would you rather never have to deal with again: nosy neighbors, parallel parking, burnt food or washing your makeup brushes? Once, I caught a neighbor going through our trash. So I could do without the nosy neighbors, LOL! 3. Have you ever crimped your hair? Yes, but sadly, I never got to do it in the ‚Äò80s (I was too young and missed all the cool stuff). 4. Who does the grocery shopping in your household? Mostly me, but El Hub will do it if he has extra time and/or if I‚Äôm busy with Connor doing extracurriculars. 5. Liquid liner: yes or no? One[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 866 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 848
description: (NOVATO) Today in cat science news! Rosie brought the full force of her four PhDs in science to solve a canine conundrum. The dilemma? Well, she started a dog training service, and she‚Äôs been trying to train Marnie, but sadly, it has not gone well. Rosie, being the cat genius she is, figured out that the key to making Marnie more receptive to instruction is to wear her out. To that end, Rosie got to work. From her lab at the Cat Academy of Sciences, she developed a new cutting edge treadmill that automatically adjusts its speed to efficiently tire out a canine jogger. So far, results have been good. Marnie has been jogging on the treadmill for 24 straight hours. At this rate, it looks like she might ‚Äî might ‚Äî start to get tired in a few days. üôÇ Hard to say, though. Marnie is on the track team at the University of Derp, so she has pretty incredible endurance. Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict, Karen The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 848 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen
